Title: How Seplat JV is turning CSI into strategy, refining Nigeria’s next generation
Summary: Seplat Energy, through its flagship PEARLs Quiz programme, is turning learning into an engine of growth . The corporate community in Nigeria shifts from investing in clinics, boreholes and roads to human capital .

Title: AKSU gets NUC approval for Faculty Of Law
Summary: The National Universities Commission (NUC) has approved the establishment of a Faculty of Law at Akwa Ibom State University (AKSU) AKSU's Academic Offerings to 11 Faculties . AKSU gets NUC approval for Faculty Of Law .

Title: Kenneth Uzoigwe on identity,  silence, charcoal in faceless presence
Summary: Charcoal artist, Kenneth Uzoigwe, a Nigerian-born creative based in Manchester, has unveiled a new work . Faceless Presence is a monochrome charcoal drawing centered on identity, silence, and emotional endurance .

Title: Art in Nigeria: Documentation determines who controls value
Summary: Art from Nigeria sits in museums across the world: catalogued, valued, insured, and supported by documentation systems built long before we began building our own . From the Dufuna Canoe to Nok; from Ife to Igbo-Ukwu to Benin, Art from Nigerians is valued, valued and insured .

Title: Show Dem Camp channels Nollywood Nostalgia in Afrika Magik listening party
Summary: Show Dem Camp (SDC) unveiled their new album AFRIKA MAGIK at an exclusive Nollywood-themed listening party held in partnership with Hennessy .

Title: Customers: Why Prostitution thrives in a hypocritical society, by Stephanie Shaakaa
Summary: Every thriving sex market from Lagos to London tells the same story . Where demand exists, supply will rise to meet it, says Stephanie Shaakaa .

Title: Nigeria, where every meeting starts with prayer, erupts in war, and ends with Amen, by Stephanie Shaakaa
Summary: We summon God at the start with bowed heads and trembling voices, promising peace, order . Then, within minutes, we descend into chaos, says Stephanie Shaakaa .

Title: Benue: Zaki Biam residents pay kidnap gangs N100,000 protection fees
Summary: Zaki Biam residents pay kidnap gangs N100,000 protection fees . “People are scared because these callers sound serious and very coordinated. We need urgent help before things get out of hand”

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, November 15, 2025
Summary: The Nigerian naira traded broadly flat on Saturday, November 15, 2025, with the official Daily Nigerian Foreign Exchange Market (NFEM) fixing hovering around ₦1,441–1,444 to the US dollar .

Title: Regina Daniels: Hospital disowns drug test result as family feud continues
Summary: Serenity Royale Hospital in Abuja has denied an alleged medical report claiming that actress Regina Daniels has been battling severe substance abuse . The viral report purportedly stated that Daniels was diagnosed with a substance use disorder and placed on a home-based detox programme starting September 24, 2025 . The document was signed by the hospital’s Managing Director

Title: Herdsmen killed my husband while he dredged sand – Enugu widow
Summary: Nkiruka Okeke, a mother of four, was stabbed to death by suspected herdsmen . Her husband, Oluzuluike, was working near a stream in Obuovia community, Enugu State . He managed to speak briefly and said, “The herdsmen stabbed me in the chest”

Title: FG unveils health strategies, digital tools to boost planning, performance
Summary: The National Health and Social Security Council announced a new plan to improve the quality of health care in Nigeria . The plan was designed to strengthen the nation’s ability to identify and manage the health of its citizens .

Title: India deports Nigerian over visa violation, drug peddling
Summary: Onyeukwu Victor was deported by the Hyderabad police on Wednesday . He arrived in India on a student visa in 2021 but continued to stay after it expired . Victor reportedly contacted drug suppliers and delivered substances to customers in Hyderabad and Bengaluru .

Title: How life Abroad humbled me — Omotola Jalade-Ekeinde
Summary: Omotola Jalade-Ekeinde, popularly known as Omo Sexy, opens up to Naomi Chima about her remarkable journey through Nollywood’s evolving landscape . She talks about her rise to stardom and battles against industry politics .
